SAINT.Name: Martyrs Eulampius and Eulampia, at Nicomedia, and 200 martyrs with them (+303-311)
Blessed Andrew of Totemsk, the Fool-for-Christ (+1673)

26 Monkmartyrs of the Zographou Monastery on Mt Athos (+1284): Abbot Thomas and the monks: Barsonuphius, Cyrill, Micah, Simon, Hillarion, James, Job, Cyprian, Sabbas, another James, Martinian, Cosmas, Sergius, Minus, Joasaph, Joannicius, Paul, Anthony, Euthemius, Dometian, Parthenius, and four laymen
Synaxis of the 7 saints of Volyn in rememberance of the return of the Pochaev Lavra to the Orthodox in 1831: Venerable Job of Pochaev
Saints Stephen and Amphilochius, Bishops of Vladimir Volynsky
Venerable Martyr Macarius, Archimandrite of Obruch
Saint Ambrose, Elder of Optina, the Wonderworker (+1891)

Synaxis of the Optina Elders: Leo, Macarius, Ambrose, Moses, Anthony, Hillarion, Isaac (the first), Anatoly (the elder), Joseph, Barsonophius, Anatoly (the younger), Nectarius, Isaac (the second), and Nikon
St Eulampe et Ste Eulampie sa soeur et leurs 200 compagnons
St André de Totma (Russie) Fol en Christ
Synaxe des sept Sts de Volhynie

Synaxe des saints peres d'Optina: Leo, Macaire, Ambroise, Moises, Antoine, Hilaire, Isaac (le premier), Anatole (l'ainee), Joseph, Barsonophe, Anatole (le jeune), Nectaire, Isaac (le second), et Nikon
Блж. Андрея, Христа ради юродивого, Тотемского (1673)
Собор святых Оптинских старцев: Льва, Макария, Амвросия, Моисея, Антония, Илариона, Исаака (первого), Анатолия (старшего), Иосифа, Варсонофия, Анатолия (младший), Нектария, Исаак (второго) и Никона
